title.narrative: FAMILY PRACTICES

description.narrative: As of 2019, prioritized families have strengthened their parental practices of early childhood within safe environments that guarantee child care, gender equality and non-discrimination, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, girls and boys under age 5 in rural, indigenous and afro-descendant communities benefit from culturally appropriate implementation of the national strategy De Cero a Siempre and other relevant policies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: As of 2019, prioritized families have strengthened their parental practices of early childhood within safe environments thatguarantee child care, gender equality and non-discrimination

description.narrative: Despite the difficulties caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, UNICEF worked with local institutions, communities and three implementing partners to adapt its technical assistance to continue working in seven mostly rural municipalities that are undergoing a socio-economic reincorporation process, to contribute to the positive transformation of male roles among 326 families and 504 community members and the improvement of their early childhood care and parenting practices, through the consolidation of five collectively built community care plans. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021
